title: Kimchi Fried Rice with Egg
description: A savory, slightly spicy Korean-style fried rice featuring tangy kimchi, tender rice, and a runny fried egg on top. Quick stir-fry technique caramelizes the kimchi and builds deep umami flavor with minimal ingredients.

ingredients.display_name: cooked short-grain white rice (cold or day-old)
ingredients.notes: preferably chilled day-old rice for best texture
well-fermented for flavor; reserve 1-2 tbsp juice
optional for more depth and heat
white and green parts separated if desired
one per serving; cook sunny-side or to preference

ingredients.display_name: sugar snap peas or optional protein (tofu/shrimp/chicken), small diced
ingredients.notes: if adding protein, adjust proportions separately

steps.text: Prep ingredients: chop kimchi and reserve any juice, mince garlic, thinly slice green onions separating whites and greens, dice carrot if using, and break rice up with a fork so it is loose and clump-free.

Heat a large nonstick or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat and add vegetable oil. When oil shimmers, add the white parts of the green onions and minced garlic; saut√© until fragrant and lightly golden.
Add the chopped kimchi (and any reserved juice) to the pan and stir-fry, pressing down to release juices; cook until the kimchi softens and some edges caramelize.
If using, add diced carrot or other vegetables/protein now and stir-fry until warmed through and slightly tender.
Reduce heat to medium. Add the cold rice to the pan, breaking up any remaining clumps, and toss thoroughly with the kimchi mixture so rice heats evenly.

Season the rice with soy sauce, optional gochujang, sugar if using, and a small pinch of salt and pepper; continue stir-frying, pressing rice against the pan occasionally to develop a little crispness.
Stir in butter if using and drizzle sesame oil; mix in green onion greens and toasted sesame seeds; taste and adjust seasoning.
In a separate small skillet, heat a little oil over medium heat and fry eggs to desired doneness (sunny-side up with runny yolk recommended). Season eggs with a pinch of salt.
Divide kimchi fried rice between plates, top each serving with a fried egg, garnish with additional green onions and sesame seeds, and serve immediately.
